title: "What are some recommended books on personality types, spirituality and homeopathy?"
first_phrase: The final 200 tokens of this text reference well-known works by internationally recognized authors on a variety of topics. These include personality types (Riso), spirituality (Shah, Singh), consciousness (Suzuki, Singh), and physics (Talbot). These works contribute to the development of multi-dimensional awareness introduced earlier in the text. This section offers readers a valuable resource list of trusted authors on topics that transcend otherwise narrowly defined fields of study.
content: Riso, D. R. (1987). Humanizing the narcissistic style. New York/ London: W.W. Norton & Co. Shah, I. (1978). Learning how to learn: Psychology and spirituality in the Sufi Way. London: Octagon Press Shah, I. (1978). A petfumed scorpion: The way to the way. San Francisco: Harper & Row Shakaran, R. (1991). The spirit of homeopathy. Bombay: Homeopathic Medical Publishers. Singh, J. (1963). Pratyabhijnahrdeyam: The secret of self recognition. Delhi: Motilal Banarsidass. Singh, J. (1979). Siva Sutra, the yoga of Supreme Identity. Delhi: Motilal Banarsidass. 279 The Way of the Human â€¢ Developing Multi-Dimensional Awareness Singh, J. (1979). Vijnanabhairava or diving consciousness. Delhi: Motilal Banarsidass. Singh, J. (1980). Spanda Karikas. Delhi: Motilal Banarsidass. Suzuki, S. Zen mind, beginner's mind. New York: Weatherhill, 1970. Talbot, M. (1981). Mysticism and the new physics. New York: Bantam Books. Talbot, M. (1987). Beyond the quantum. New York: Bantam Books.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the sources listed here offer great resources for those interested in humanizing the narcissistic style, learning about psychology and spirituality, holistic medicine, self-recognition, and the exploration of consciousness. These books are valuable tools for personal development and expanding one's awareness in various dimensions of life.
